snippet: American officials appear to be seeking a solution in which Iran would be allowed to enrich uranium at the low level of 3.5 percent during an interim agreement and also under a comprehensive accord.
abstract: American officials appear to be seeking agreement in which Iran would be allowed to enrich uranium at low level of 3.5 percent during interim period and also under comprehensive accord; officials say that deal could provide solution to one of major stumbling blocks in effort to freeze Iran's nuclear program.
lead_paragraph: American officials appear to be seeking a solution in which Iran would be allowed to enrich uranium at the low level of 3.5 percent during an interim agreement and also under a comprehensive accord.

headline.main: Compromise May Be Near for Iran Nuclear Deal, U.S. Official Says
headline.print_headline: Compromise May Be Near for Iran Nuclear Deal, U.S. Official Says
